history.content: Yes, you need to submit the l&s double major application form. The form requires advisor signatures from both the physics and cs department.

children.subject: After you complete your other major requirements. Some major let you declare while completing your last major requirement concurrently, you should ask a physics major advisor on when you can declare.
<md>@Anon Gear Do I do that after completing the physics lower-division reqs, or right now?</md>

history.content:
<md>Hi, all! I'm a freshman (or, I guess, rising sophomore now?) who's intending to double major in CS + Physics. I've just completed my declaration requirements for CS, and have submitted the CS declaration form already. However, I won't complete my lower-division physics requirements until the end of my sophomore year (i.e., end of Spring 2021). At what point do I need to get advisor approval and submit a double major application?

Thanks in advance.</md>
history.subject: Double Major Application Logistics
